text: Displacement or displacement tonnage is the weight of water that a ship pushes aside when it is floating, which in turn is the weight of a ship (and its contents). It is usually applied to naval vessels rather than commercial ones, and is measured when the ship's fuel tanks are full and all stores are aboard.Dear and Kemp, 2006, p.588George, 2005, p. 68. Merchant vessels use other measures such as net tonnage, gross tonnage, or deadweight tonnage. == References == Category:Ships
title: Displacement (ship)
